pullrequest.title: Tutorial for installing on ubuntu on windows (WSL)

content.raw:
I gave this a couple of quick attempts. I was able to install WSL somehow even get some of the gazebo downloads but straight away I started getting weird problems with WSL. My first issue is around networking. ifconfig won't work for me and I can't even work out how to elevate my bash session to root despite uninstalling and re-installing WSL. From what I've read the first version of WSL had a root bash shell only but the version I've got installs as a user level shell.

I'm not inclined to spend much more time with getting gazebo running on WSL at this stage. Once it gets a bit more stable it may be worth another look although I did note one of the very first things mentioned on the msdn blog is that it's not intended for GUI apps.
